intro: Impatiens kamerunensis subsp. obanensis, commonly known as the Obanensis Impatiens, is a flowering plant native to the highland regions of Cameroon. It belongs to the genus Impatiens in the family Balsaminaceae, characterized by its delicate, showy flowers. The subspecies is distinguished by its slightly larger flowers and more robust growth compared to other members of the species. It typically grows in shaded, moist environments, often in forest understories. Its botanical significance lies in its unique morphology and ecological adaptation to its native habitat.
